title: Establishes the instruction of sexual abuse and sexual assault prevention in elementary and secondary schools
summary: Establishes the instruction of sexual abuse and sexual assault prevention in elementary and secondary schools; directs the commissioner of education, in conjunction with the office of children and family services, the division of state police and rape crisis educators, to provide and prescribe a course of instruction in sexual abuse and sexual assault prevention, including materials for parents.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1667

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 11, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen. SAMPSON -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation  to  the  instruction  of
         sexual abuse and sexual assault prevention in elementary and secondary
         schools

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The education law is amended by adding a new section 815 to
    2  read as follows:
    3    S 815. INSTRUCTION IN SEXUAL ABUSE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT  PREVENTION.  1.
    4  THE  COMMISSIONER, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE OFFICE OF CHILDREN AND FAMILY
    5  SERVICES, THE DIVISION OF STATE POLICE AND  RAPE  CRISIS  EDUCATORS,  IS
    6  HEREBY  DIRECTED  TO  PROVIDE  AND  PRESCRIBE A COURSE OF INSTRUCTION IN
    7  SEXUAL ABUSE AND  SEXUAL  ASSAULT  PREVENTION  FOR  ALL  ELEMENTARY  AND
    8  SECONDARY PUPILS.
    9    2.  SUCH  PREVENTION CURRICULUM SHALL BE AGE APPROPRIATE FOR ALL PUPIL
   10  AGE GROUPS. THE AGE APPROPRIATENESS OF EACH  LEVEL  OF  SUCH  CURRICULUM
   11  SHALL  BE DETERMINED BY THE COMMISSIONER, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE OFFICE
   12  OF CHILDREN AND FAMILY SERVICES, THE DIVISION OF STATE POLICE  AND  RAPE
   13  CRISIS  EDUCATORS.  SUCH  CURRICULUM SHALL BE TAUGHT BY EITHER CLASSROOM
   14  TEACHERS OR HEALTH EDUCATION TEACHERS ON AN  ON-GOING  BASIS  THROUGHOUT
   15  THE  SCHOOL  YEAR.  EVERY  INSTRUCTOR  OF SUCH CURRICULUM SHALL ATTEND A
   16  TRAINING CLASS ESTABLISHED BY THE COMMISSIONER, IN CONJUNCTION WITH  THE
   17  OFFICE OF CHILDREN AND FAMILY SERVICES, THE DIVISION OF STATE POLICE AND
   18  RAPE CRISIS EDUCATORS.
   19    3.  SUCH  CURRICULUM  SHALL  ALSO  INCLUDE  EDUCATIONAL  MATERIALS FOR
   20  PARENTS REGARDING HOW TO AID IN KEEPING THEIR CHILDREN SAFE FROM  SEXUAL
   21  ABUSE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT.
   22    S  2.  This act shall take effect on the first of July next succeeding
   23  the date on which it shall have become a law.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05897-01-1
